name: Sean J. Taylor
tweet: I wish I were a fraction as good at explaining complex ideas as Tai-Danae. She has an amazing gift, I'm looking forward to checking out her thesis. This blog post from last year transformed how I think about matrices:  https://www.math3ma.com/blog/matrices-probability-graphs¬†‚Ä¶ (don't miss the sequel to that post!) https://twitter.com/math3ma/status/1249862830670729217¬†‚Ä¶

name: Tai-Danae Bradley
tweet: My PhD thesis ‚ÄúAt the Interface of Algebra and Statistics‚Äù is now on the arXiv!  http://arxiv.org/abs/2004.05631¬† It uses basic tools in quantum physics to explore mathematical structure that's both algebraic & statistical. Curious? See my new 10m video on YouTube!!  http://youtu.be/wiadG3ywJIs¬† pic.twitter.com/U8X622mtse

name: Chris Said
tweet:
The highest quality Jupyter notebook I've ever seen was just posted by... <checks notes>... ex-CEO of Instagram, Kevin Systrom?

All of us data scientists can hang our heads in shame.

h/t (@seanjtaylor ) https://github.com/k-sys/covid-19/blob/master/Realtime%20R0.ipynb¬†‚Ä¶

name: Matthew Honnibal
tweet:
Now that @karpathy has everyone talking about understanding backprop again, I got inspired to finish my own weird takeü§ì

To understand algorithms I always imagine stepping through them. So here's how backprop might feel from the inside?

üìù  https://thinc.ai/docs/backprop101¬†‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/uJk0Bry28M

name: Danielle Navarro
tweet:
Kind of.

As far as I can tell, gganimate and geom_bezier2() don't play well together - @thomasp85, is that right?

But... you can still generate the data structure using flametree_grow() and then create your own animated plot based on geom_line()

 https://gist.github.com/djnavarro/7a3d970372631e9443c108d9e2fe905d¬†‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/HUYL5JJ3xd

tweet: There's an implementation that has 10 lines of code ;-) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FtnkqIsfNQc¬†‚Ä¶

name: Andrej Karpathy
tweet: ok I'm pretty sure I wrote the tiniest autograd engine with a neural net library on top of it, weighing about ~50 LOC for the engine, ~50 LOC for the neural net library, and it's super cute and totally works. MicroGrad:  https://github.com/karpathy/randomfun/blob/master/MicroGrad.ipynb¬†‚Ä¶ üòÇ

name: ericmjl@localhost:8888
tweet: A new thing I learned, ready to share! #Markov models and their variants, particularly #autoregressive HMMs. If those terms confused you before, hopefully my explainer clears some things up. Bonus: we show it with #bayesian inference for free!  https://ericmjl.github.io/essays-on-data-science/machine-learning/markov-models/¬†‚Ä¶

tweet: There's one metric that can help us through the next few months. For your Sunday reading, here's what it is, how to calculate it, and what it looks like by US State http://systrom.com/blog/the-metric-we-need-to-manage-covid-19/¬†‚Ä¶
